rows.text: I have worked with PUSH for over 5 years now. The agency manages our search and paid social media marketing. We have consistently exceeded our paid media KPIs well below our target CPA. Our non-traditional relationship with the agency means with have a hands on approach to campaign management based on a mutual respect. Over the years, we have worked with their creative team and web development too. They always seem to manage to be one step ahead and on top of trends so we had their creative team run training session with us as well. What is so impressive about PUSH is that over our working relationship I personally have met their staff that are not even on our account and they make conscious effort to say hello at every opportunity. I don't always know what they do, but I do know who they are!

reply.text: Thank you, Dijana, for your fantastic review and for being a valued partner for the last 5+ years. We're pleased to have exceeded your expectations across our services and are especially grateful for your appreciation of our team's approach. Here's to continuing our successful journey together!

rows.text:
I regret to express my dissatisfaction with Push Group, a digital marketing and SEO company. My experience with them has been disheartening, as they failed to uphold basic standards in their service delivery. From glaring spelling mistakes in promotional materials to incorrect artwork sent from other clients, it was clear that attention to detail was sorely lacking and this happened on a number of occasions in a short period of time.
One alarming discovery was their practice of outsourcing labor to freelancers in South Africa and other countries while charging premium prices and falsely claiming all work was done in-house. The initial promises made by the management team were impressive, but the subsequent handover to a less responsive team was disappointing. Attempts to contact them were met with difficulty, as calls often went unanswered and emails were sent in bulk within a short timeframe which shows they don’t work on the account daily and only allocate certain days or short periods of time.
Moreover, there was a consistent failure to log into the social media management portal, indicating a lack of commitment to ongoing client engagement. Unfortunately, I made the mistake of recommending Push Group to another company, only for both of us to realise the subpar service, poor deliverables, and inadequate management processes.
Push Group appears to be a deceptive organisation that compromises on quality, starting from the top. If you value the integrity of your social media presence and brand design and revenue, I strongly advise steering clear of Push Group and considering a more reputable option based in the UK with a dedicated team, such as VagaBond Digital which have now come to the rescue and within weeks my business message and overall brand design is back to where it should have been and sales started to increase after a huge car crash of decline due to Push Groups poor delivery of brand assets and messages and adverts.
My additional comment on the 5/1/24 thank you for your reply to my comment, interesting how many bad reviews and the replies to the customer is that it is there fault always. If we were so in the wrong and poor communication which never happened from our side as well as having scheduled calls why did you dismiss a team member due to our issues and complaints. Personally I think that is awful behaviour from your company the staff member had no management or guidance as you have to many processes in the company and no actual time for staff. Whew we were told this we were shocked as that is not how you treat staff and to remove a staff member and not mentor them shows a-lot about the kill, and head hunt culture that goes on internally but also with customer when they complain and not happy.

reply.text: We appreciate your feedback. It was a difficult situation for both parties. As discussed at the outset, modern marketing is highly complex and requires an …We appreciate your feedback. It was a difficult situation for both parties. As discussed at the outset, modern marketing is highly complex and requires an intimate partnership. Your own team's lack of timely and consistent feedback sits at the heart of  many of the issues you raise.From our perspective there are some fundamental issues we feel you need to address as a business that are beyond the normal relationship between a client and agency. These include clarity and consistency of strategic direction along with clear and regular communication with any agency partner. We will expand on these points and hope you find this helpful as we indeed value your feedback. Whilst you may have worked with many agencies, we ourselves have worked with hundreds of clients over 15 years and are very clear on how a productive client/agency relationship works. Expanding on your specific concerns, we sincerely regret any dissatisfaction experienced with the creatives and social media management. You received multiple emails from the team at Push which went unanswered for weeks, many of which were questions regarding important next steps like budgets, approval of creatives and copy, requests for creative content or trying to schedule a shoot with you  in person. Because of that, a lot of actions were not implemented or delayed. Our team was steadfast in supporting the growth of your business, clearly outlining short-term and long-term focuses. However, effective communication and goal alignment became increasingly challenging, with regularly scheduled check-ins being frequently missed without explanation.While we take responsibility for mistakes in some creatives, it's important to note that some of the information highlighted as inaccurate on the creatives was directly sourced from your own website and is currently still live.Halfway through our partnership, you raised with our lead Account Director and Product Strategy Director that the strategic direction that had been agreed by you was now changing again so we had to revise the entire scope of work for you. We advised you strongly to focus on one goal, build the brand presence, and slowly introduce advertising in Q3 and Q4. Instead you focused on launching your brand in multiple retailers, working with a PR agency and paying for an extremely expensive shoot with a video agency. We even tried working with that video agency to ensure the content is usable for our purposes. Our head of creative then provided an amazing brief and on the day, you then forced the video agency to go a completely different direction, producing things that were unusable on social media.You are well aware that our team went over and above what was required in our contract. Indeed, you shared on LinkedIn 6 months ago where you referred to the “remarkable progress” we were making together. On multiple occasions you requested us to work outside of our official agreement. Our lead Account Director joined multiple calls with your other agencies - one was even a pitch by a PR agency for the US. You asked about our opinions and feedback on your partnership with AllBeauty retailer and other projects.Regarding Push staff based in South Africa, we want to clarify that our core team has always been based in the UK where we employ over 40 people. We conducted face-to-face meetings, led and supported location shoots. Our diverse team also includes members from South Africa, the UAE and Greece.We've consistently made efforts to address your concerns, but our attempts were met with silence. We are committed to resolving issues promptly, and it's disheartening when our attempts to communicate and rectify are not reciprocated.Constructive dialogue is crucial for resolution, and we regret that we couldn't achieve that in this instance. Nonetheless, we sincerely wish you all the best in your future endeavours.We would welcome any dialogue with you even at this stage if you would like to contact us directly.More

rows.text:
Fraudulent trading and stole money from a card when we told them we were leaving.
I had a highly disappointing experience with Push Group. Their performance was abysmal, and I found their lack of monthly meetings and communication deeply concerning. It felt like my business was an afterthought to them.
One of the major issues was their mismanagement of our PPC campaigns. They set them to the default settings, resulting in a tremendous waste of our budget. The lack of attention to detail and expertise was evident, as the campaigns failed to generate any meaningful results. It was a clear indication of their incompetence in handling pay-per-click advertising.
Furthermore, the promised monthly meetings never materialized. There was a complete lack of proactive communication and reporting on the progress of our campaigns. It felt as if our business was being ignored, and our concerns were left unanswered. When they did turn up Slav never showed up and we had an embarrassing wait for his colleague.
Frustrated with the poor performance and lack of accountability, we decided to switch to UK Digital Marketing. It turned out to be a game-changer for us. In just two weeks, they managed to triple our leads using the same budget that Push Group had been squandering. The stark contrast in results only highlighted the sheer ineffectiveness of Push Group's strategies. The will blame tracking of leads but we have not changed a single thing that side just better management.
I strongly caution against engaging with Push Group for your marketing needs. Their incompetence and lack of professionalism have cost us valuable time and resources. Seek a reliable and competent marketing agency like UK Digital Marketing, who prioritize their clients' success and deliver exceptional results.

reply.text: Dear Elham,Thank you for sharing your feedback. We are genuinely sorry to hear that your …Dear Elham,Thank you for sharing your feedback. We are genuinely sorry to hear that your experience did not meet your expectations, and we appreciate the opportunity to address your concerns.At PR Agency One, we strive to deliver excellent results and maintain transparency with our clients. We understand the challenges faced by new brands in the competitive FMCG sector, especially those with limited budgets. Our team was committed to your project and worked diligently to secure meaningful media coverage within the constraints provided.Regarding the contractual obligations and the discussions around them, it was always our intention to adhere strictly to the agreed terms while continuously seeking to adapt our strategies to better serve your campaign’s goals. Our suggestion to extend the campaign was made in good faith, based on our professional assessment of what was required to achieve more impactful results.We regret any misunderstanding regarding the completion of the contract and the additional outreach suggested. they contacted me via whats app. unsolicited.
and offered me money for following their customers on instagram and so on.

sorry mates, you're probably doing a good job in your field, but writing to people unsolicited and the whole system of buying followers and reviews is just rubbish.

reply.text: Hi Maura, thank you for getting in contact with us. We're very sorry to inform that we have been experiencing an issue with scammers reaching via WhatsApp in the name of our company. This person is NOT affiliated with our business in any …Hi Maura, thank you for getting in contact with us. We're very sorry to inform that we have been experiencing an issue with scammers reaching via WhatsApp in the name of our company. This person is NOT affiliated with our business in any way, shape, or form, and we are very sorry that you have been subject to their actions. Do note our only phone number is 020 4513 9345 as seen on our website, we have no other phone numbers. We have been very concerned about this issue and after further investigation, we discovered this scammer has contacted several of the public on separate numbers. After trying to contact them ourselves they repopulate on a different number, all of which we have reported and blocked. Similarly, all we can advise is for you to block and report the number, as again, we do not know who this person is, and they are not associated with our business in any way.In light of this issue, we had briefed our customer support staff to advise the above to anyone contacting regarding the scam, and advise caution with any information or links sent within their messages. As a further precaution, we have posted a post to our social media and also our Google My Business listing to advise the public regarding this issue for any future reference. This can be seen on our linkedin here: https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:7194693684783710208 as well as any of our verified business pages. We're very sorry to hear that you have been a victim of this issue but we do want to reassure you that once again, this is not our business - our contact details are as follows on our website, and these are the only contact details we have and can reach out on. Finally and just for further clarification, buying followers is not a service we offer, as supported by our website offering nor do we endorse this. Should you need any further support please don't hesitate to reach out to us and again, we are very sorry for the inconvenience caused by this issue. As a final note, we would be very grateful if this review could be removed, as this does not reflect our organisation and practices, and we have done our very best to protect and support anyone who has fallen victim to this issue. Wishing you a lovely day.Kind regards,Emma, Operations ManagerMore

reply.text: Jasmine, thank you for sharing your concerns with us. We are sorry to hear that you were not satisfied with our services. …Jasmine, thank you for sharing your concerns with us. We are sorry to hear that you were not satisfied with our services.At Passion, we strive to offer the highest level of service to all our clients, and we regret that we did not meet your expectations in this instance. We apologise for any inconvenience caused by some mistakes in copy at the start of our business relationship and for missing a piece of information on a handover when people changed in your account. We understand how important it is to ensure that the work delivered is accurate and meets your requirements, and that is why we apologised and rectified the issue immediately. We also recognise the importance of meeting projections for SEO activities. The results in terms of rankings, traffic and organic transactions have all been fantastic and we aimed to even submit and award for it. Some results of our work and optimisations are below.•	Generic clicks increased from 92,500 in May 2022 to 322,900 in April 2023 (249% increase)•	Organic transactions increased by 250% in the same time period•	Organic sessions increased by 280% in the same time period•	DA improved by 78% from link building activity between December 2022 and May 2023 (9 to 16)Regarding the changes to clauses in the contract, we apologise for any confusion caused. We changed our master services agreement across the board with all clients, our intention was not to change the terms without prior communication with you, but send it over for your approval. We value transparency and communication with our clients, and we understand the importance of being clear and upfront in our dealings.Finally, we are sorry that we have been late delivering the last of our deliveries for our last month of working together, but our intention was (and still is, despite this review) to fulfil the hours and send the last deliverable to you.   We appreciate your feedback and will use it to improve our services. If you would like to discuss this matter further, please do not hesitate to contact me directly at cecilia@passiondigital.co.uk CeciliaMore

I highly recommend Sniro to businesses looking to elevate their digital presence and streamline operations.

I really enjoyed Sophie's 7 day content creation course. Sophie has structured the course well. The lessons are broken down into small sections so you can easily digest the key idea. It's a super practical course with actions for each lesson. I think that's what separates it from other advice. It encouraged me to get actively involved in planning and creating content, not just read about it. Thank you Sophie :)

I've just finished Sophie's "Content Creation" course and it was so helpful, I plan to take her "LinkedIn for Humans" course in January.

I highly recommend Sophie's LinkedIn for Humans course .
Before starting, I was scared of LinkedIn. I didn't feel clear on how to act or what to post or how to join the party. I knew it was a treasure trove of leads and networking opportunities but I felt like I was watching through the window.
Completing LfH has turned things around for me. Thanks to Sophie's no-nonsense explanations and thought-provoking tasks I have a road-map for content and engagement that feels authentic, natural and "me". Sophie's course has given me the confidence I needed to start developing on-brand, useful content for my feed. As well as actionable advice, she's filled me with enthusiasm for the opportunities the platform offers.
Thank you, Sophie!
Positive

Quality

I've always known that LinkedIn is my best source of quality leads, but I found that being present on the platform felt like a chore. Committing to try harder, I was crazy excited when Sophie announced her 'LinkedIn for Humans' course and got my name down on the list to get access at the earliest moment possible.
It did not disappoint.
In fact, it's done more than I ever thought possible. I just wanted to learn to love the platform, and already it's thrown up an opportunity to work with a dream client.
I devoured the course in one night, loving every moment of Sophie's wisdom and completing every exercise. Then I started putting her lessons into practice. Within 2 days (yes, 2 days!!):
• I went from ranking in the top 3% in my industry to the top 2%, achieving an SSI score of 65/100.
• I went from ranking in the top 25% of people in my network to the top 20%.
• I received +38% views on my profile page.
• I had a dream client reach out and request to connect with me.
In 48-hours Sophie has helped me to put my business on the path to great things, given me a huge morale boost...and learn to love LinkedIn (well, just a tiny bit!).
I'm now super excited to see how it evolves and support my current marketing campaigns and (hopefully!) delivers greater returns.

I've just completed the Thoughtfully 21-day Marketing Masterclass. It's incredibly good value as there is so much content to it, delivered in short lesson and tasks, so you can do it at your own pace. It really made me think – not just about how to market myself as a freelancer, but about what I do, who I want to work with and, importantly, how to make my marketing more about my ideal clients.

Thoughtfully Marketing Masterclass

Sophie speaks with common sense with a sprinkle of humour dotted in. Although each task is short, it will encourage you to think deeper into each principle. I really enjoyed the course and have taken a lot of practical knowledge in a short amount of time. If this wasn't enough, Sophie is always on hand with a friendly word or clarification. Thank you!

Unfortunately my experience with Spellbrand has been very poor and I use the word unfortunate because despite not reaching a satisfying result they were unwilling to offer a refund when I said I wanted to use an alternative agency. The job at hand was a new brand name for the company and their first round of ideas were either tacky or regurgitated from a Greek-English dictionary. The second round of ideas was worse and not without enormous delay. I always found that it was me contacting them and not the other way around. I would not recommend this company on service, experience or results. I have since found a local company who came up with a selection of good ideas which we narrowed down to end up with something we are really happy with. Most importantly the company that we eventually worked with offered their first round of ideas including brand name and logo design for free as they understood my position having paid upfront with Spellbrand.

Mash and Steve at SpellBrand have delivered an excellent result for us. Far beyond what we initially expected. I must admit we were probably a very demanding customer for them, as we were very clear on what we wanted to achieve but had no idea of how to get there. They worked on several ideas and came up with a very diverse set of initial concepts and designs that helped us define what we needed. Thanks to their positive attitude, determination and ongoing support, we now have a visually stunning and very identifiable logo and brand image. We are thrilled! If we have to build a brand image again in the future, we will definitely hire SpellBrand.

After being with an agency for quite a while and with no progress I approached an 'expert' SEO company and all sounded very good. However, with no results with them, I spent a great of time researching what do to next and who to ask for help.
I came across ClickSlice and had a chat with Josh.
He sent me a very detailed report showing where the previous people had been going wrong and how ClickSlice would be able to rectify the problems with my website.
I have seven main categories with seven main search phrases. At the time of my talk with ClickSlice, none of the seven main search phrases were in the top 100.
He seemed very convincing and I agreed to a three-month initial contract with them. To ensure we were not targeting too much I agreed that we would only concentrate on four key phrases. With the previous agency, I had asked them to target all seven.
The cost would be £6,000 per month, £18,000 in total, to target four key phrases.
There were lots of people involved during the campaign which seemed a little daunting. Maybe the wider expertise would be an asset.
After about 6 weeks I noticed there was no movement at all on the search phrases. I know that search results take a long time but to see NO movement at all in the top 100 was worrying. I sent an email to ClickSlice and received an answer - the main thing is that answering my worries and queries takes time and it would be best not to bother them and ask questions during the campaign (??)
We are a small family business, my son, my wife, myself and two salespeople. £18,000 is a fortune to us and to be told not to bother them during the campaign was surprising - to say the least.
At the end of the three months, there had been NO progress, none of the four (just 4) keyphrases were in the top 100.
There was a misunderstanding (??) about the three months initial contract and I was sent a bill for the fourth month which was disappointing, to say the least.
After paying £18,000 for optimising 4 key phrases and none in the top 100, even after saying they knew why my site was not ranking, I can not recommend ClickSlice at all.
In answer to Clickslice stating they had increased my organic clicks by 19% - this does not appear to be the case when you look on Google's Webmaster Console which has the actual amount of clicks received.
May 15th to June 15th we had 10.6K organic clicks
June 16th to July 15th we had 8.42K organic clicks
July 16th to August 15th we had 7.85K organic clicks
August 16th to September 15th we had 8.2K organic clicks
September 16th to October 15th we had 7.63K organic clicks
Clickslice campaign started on 19th June (date of on boarding meeting) and ran for three months - 19th September.
Over that period the number of organic clicks dropped and did not increase. Like wise impressions fell as well.
I have to say that I disagree with Clickslice's reply and just accept that they were not able to meet my expectations and put it down to experience. It appears I was the unlucky one.
Also, I am unable to access any of my reports from Clickslice.

Cognition is the best marketing agency we have dealt with. Uniquely they are passionate about taking an evidence based approach which pulls together the available sales and marketing data together with some extraordinary insights into the psychology of the target audience.
Our initial request was to sort out and refresh our website. We were so impressed that they didn't want to spend money on marketing activities without first investigating the evidence and understanding our market place and customers. This involved some qualitative one to one and group work with customers and prospects, plus an in depth quantitative analysis of the data from all available sources.
This phase of the work also involved some invigorating and challenging questions relating to our core proposition,  our values as a business and sorting out our key messaging. The Dr of Psychology who is one of the founders of the agency certainly kept us on our toes and challenged our conventional thinking.
Only then did Cognition commence on rebuilding our website and sorting out the user experience. Once the relaunch is complete most agencies run out of steam. Not Cognition. Their excellent account managers were relentless on continuing their data driven and evidence based approach to planning subsequent campaigns. This meant effective A/B testing on each campaign which enabled us to have confidence that we would achieve return on investment before we even launched the campaign.
The next stage of our Cognition journey was to harness all sources of data. This involved the implementation of HubSpot and the integration of our data sources from our existing CMS and our ERP system so we could build one strong sales, marketing and analytics platform
This phase of the journey was a revelation as we saw the power of data to analyse our user journeys and build more effective inbound content to nurture prospects along the funnel. It also had a very beneficial effect at pulling our sales and marketing teams together as both departments could see the joint power of their more joined up team work.
Building on this strong data platform, we love the real time evidence produced by HubSpot on the effectiveness of our ongoing sales and marketing activities. The virtuous circle of evidence/testing/action/analysis that Cognition has deployed continues to deliver strong growth in the business.
Our journey began in 2015 and I cannot speak highly enough of Cognition as a modern, data driven, evidence based, creative digital agency.

We completed a brand strategy last year with Ventur agency to help capture and document who we are, why we do what we do, who our customers are, who our team should be and untapped market opportunities to take.
Going on this journey has been a fascinating progression for the company, where we have not only achieved the goals we set out to, but we understand how and why we have, which is far more important.
Almost every goal and line item in the strategy has been executed (or is in the process of being executed), and Kaine has been with us for the journey, checking in to see where things are going right, and also delivering some hard truths as to where other elements in the business aren’t aligning with what we set out.
The most fascinating of these is the sale of our courses. We tried the classic business approach of throwing money at marketing to hook strong leads, and this did not work. Kaine then set out a document with a clear sales journey for us that instantly fixed the problem, and in the process we learnt so much valuable information about who our customers are and why traditional social media advertising is not the right approach. Most importantly course sales are above predictions and our agreed milestones.
Ventur are on the journey with you to reach the destination, not just to get off once the invoice has been paid and cleared.
Excellent company. Great communication throughout the process, listened to feedback and delivered on time. Would definitely recommend!

Internship review - Marketing
I have worked with Cosmonauts on my 2 month marketing internship. I have applied for this while still being a full time university student, where I needed a couple of weeks' real life experience.
Cosmonauts has been so pleasant and flexible in taking me on, I was able to negotiate my availability in hours and internship length as well. Arranging all this in the middle of a pandemic seem like a difficult task for me, but Cosmonauts has taken me on just as promised, only working with them from home. I have thoroughly enjoyed my time, I have been able to tailor my training to my own and the businesses' needs, I gained first hand experience in content writing, becoming a published writer, while also working with the wider team, and external clients. I was also very well supported in my university studies and dissertation. My experience working from home has been very great, being trained from a distance sounded impossible, and turned out smooth and just as inclusive as it would have been in the office.
My internship was more than I expected, the team is dynamic, constantly on the ball, ready to take anything on, I was taken on so easily and readily.  I expected a set corporate long winded training, but Cosmonauts has been trusting in my creativity and gave me my own responsibilities to work as I work best, which I guess is kind of the dream of someone working in marketing! I have learnt a lot of useful skills, including prioritising and organising working on various projects at the same time, communicating through the whole company with different departments and clients. Most importantly I learnt a lot about myself, and the key skills I possess that make me valuable in the workplace.
I would definitely recommend taking your internship at Cosmonauts, even if you are a bit unsure about your own skills, they will see you as a unique person with valuable capabilities, and will help you work on your weaknesses too. There is a brilliant atmosphere and team of lovely people :)

I attended a 10 weeks internship at Cosmonauts and I loved the time spent with the team. Everyone has been amazing, always available and extremely inclusive from Day One. The team is young, dynamic and fun to be around but at the same time everyone is so passionate about their job. That automatically transfers to you, pushing to give your best.
The pandemic hit hard the whole country, and a young gradated like me couldn't have hoped for a better opportunity. Despite the numerous restrictions, we managed to keep going to the office, with the option for those who didn't feel like it, to stay at home. If in a first moment I decided to keep going, which gave me back that lost feeling of normality, during this lockdown I am now working from home. Somehow I still feel like I am in the office, wherever I am working form - still, everyone is 100% available, all the time, and they show closure and try to help in any way possible. It was actually over any expectation I could have had.
The internship at Cosmonauts was actually the first one in my life, and, when I got it, I started with the expectation that, as an intern, I would have been there mainly observing, helping out with printing, and sometimes bringing coffees around. Instead, I was COMPLETELY INVOLVED in their projects from my first week, they gave me tasks that allowed me to learn so many thing, even slightly different from my field of studies, and the best thing is that I always was given the space and the time to learn. I never felt rushed, or judged or not appreciated, it was really an amazing first experience and I would suggest it strongly to anyone.
It is a crazy bunch here at Cosmonauts, but anyone can fit it!
P.S. I am now a Graphic Designer at Cosmonauts

I also like that after our website was initially designed and set up, we were taught how to add pages and posts to it ourselves (though it's certainly a work in progress on my part!). I really feel like Ripplenet cares about us as people and not just as a customer and I know that should anything go wrong, I can trust Ripplenet to resolve the problem quickly and efficiently with no messing about.

Huge thanks to Ripplenet Web Design in London for their excellent e-commerce development service.  From conception to completion they took away the worry and stress of getting my very own online shop ready for business.

BECAUSE truly understand the value of great, impactful, memorable consumer interaction on building brand love. They are very passionate about our brands, very creative with the unique ideas they suggest on how to break through the noise but also very practical, looking at the reality of both the environment but also hitting the kpis. The work they have done for Haagen Dazs and Nature Valley have had real impact, talkability and have engaged consumers in a far more meaningful way than any other media we have used. The upfront planning, their ability to turn 121 into 1 to many through technology & social media and the attention to detail set them apart from other agencies. Truly great value for money.
BEcause is a terrific agency - full of passion, expertise and talented people all committed to delivering incredible and memorable brand experiences. Highly recommended.

This guy is a Joke!
I personally don't believe the work on his website is his. He charges nearly £600 for a logo, however, what he produced for me was a cheap knock-off stock image. He completely ignored my detailed logo brief in-order to cut corners. He was less than forthcoming in admitting it wasn't free drawn but instead a stock image, and when i asked for a refund he refused claiming, "I can't disagree with his work" as per his Terms and Conditions!!
I only wish i could upload the ridiculous childlike work he produced!!
I would also be weary regarding the validity of the other reviews.
Avoid at all costs!!

There are a number of reasons why I cannot recommend Adam enough:
First, as a self-funded start-up, there were strict budget constraints for the project yet Adam was able to deliver a quality product within those constraints and without any surprises.
Second, both his stakeholder and general management are excellent. The entire project was conducted remotely but at no point did I feel unattended to or dismissed; communication through all phases of the project was consistent and effective.
Finally, he's a good designer and so is able to offer professional insight/advice.

Adam designed my branding, logo and website.  I'm delighted with it and regularly receive positive comments about it.  It's a joy to hand out my business cards!  I found thinking about the structure and look of my website a bit overwhelming on my own.  Adam got to know me and my business and worked with me so that I got exactly what I was looking for, and he gave useful advice along the way - saying what would and wouldn't work.  Adam is great to work with.  He has a very keen eye for detail!  I wouldn't hesitate to recommend Adam to anyone looking for branding or a website.

Adam designed my companies branding and website and I couldn’t be happier with what he produced. He took all my comments on board and created exactly what I head in my head... but better. Thank you! Would highly recommend!

Adam is one of the best Freelancers I have ever worked with. He is very disciplined with time and understands the importance timely deliverables. Having worked with many freelancers, it was easy to know I'd found a dependable one. I will recommend him any day.
Disruptive! Creative! Efficient!
The best marketing services provided company

All been a great insight into the nuts and bolts of how top quality digital products get built.

Recently finished working with Crowdform on the development of an iOS dating application. And I've got to say I was very impressed. Their professionalism and willingness to go the extra mile really was exemplary.
Would wholeheartedly recommend.

Great company. Thanks for having me.

Then, when you are rightfully upset because they don't respond, they'll then respond to your upset message and say "we can't help now, because of the messages tone". They don't seem to realize that when you don't support paying customers, it's going to naturally upset people. So, that behavior will naturally bring angry emails, due to their own doing. Being nice doesn't get you a response from support, so people will rightfully be upset. For some reason, they can't grok this simple concept.

I sat in the waiting room for a good hour, smelt of gone off tuna (weird) was very rude and started shouting "YA GET ME YA FEEL ME" and said I should go home and listen to a podcast named tunas lies , something like that anyway.

Internet services? Yea that's right. Your dirty little Only Fans that turns my stomach inside out. They're vile. For €3 each.....Is that so they're affordable for young people?

The owner was very rude and demeaning to my Girlfriend who just wants to be a star. She makes the best Tuna Potato in the country and the moment she said tuna he started kicking off saying he doesn't like tuna and pulled a weird face.

rows.text:
I have used Palace Promotions for several years as my printer of choice.
In all this time I had never had an issue, even as a newcomer to getting stuff printed, Stelios took me through the requirements without making me feel like I was asking silly questions.
I have a well used roll up banner, a standard banner, leaflets and various batches of business cards printed over this time.
All fantastic service at a good price, and just what I needed.
However the test for really good service is when something goes wrong and how it is handled.  I recently had a new sign printed, and when I got it back to my workshop I noticed there was a problem with it.
Long story short, I approved artwork that had a small error in it.  I also checked it when collecting it from the shop.  The error was entirely my issue, you would need to know my logo well to have picked it up.  When I contacted Stelios, he was more than helpful in getting a correct sign printed and to me in short order.
Given this was entirely my error, he was entitled to charge me a stupidity tax (full fees) for the reprint, however the reprint was done at a discounted rate.    This is truly great customer service.

I have been ordering with Palace Promotions for many years now and the results are always great! Such a wonderful company to work with. Great service and always delivered on time!
Positive

Responsiveness, Quality, Professionalism, Value
Very helpful communications to help me get what I wanted and amazingly good final product. Highly recommended!

Stelios & his team go the extra mile to ensure that all design details are correct prior to print. Great quality advertising boards & banners for our local business have been complimented by our customers both existing & new, stationery items were also great. Thanks for your efficient, quality & professional service, will definitely recommend their trusted service.
great

Wow. Wow. Wow  I went in there to fix my sons Chelsea shirt (no abuse please) as the number had come off. When I went to collect it not only had they done it perfectly BUT they took it upon themselves to do the name as well for no extra charge as they thought it was going to come off. . Now that is impressive. Than you very much, you made my  13 year old very happy.
Professional and friendly service. Also affordable prices (£1 for an A4 colour printing). I do definitely recommend them.
